data.title: Mike Miller’s Let It Fly Sports Bar to Make Mississippi Debut at Silo Square
data.meta_description: Let It Fly Sports Bar, the eater-tainment concept from former Memphis Grizzlies shooting guard Mike Miller, is set to open its third location in Southaven’s...
data.meta_site_name: What Now Memphis: The Best Source for Memphis News
data.text:
Let It Fly Sports Bar, the eater-tainment concept from former Memphis Grizzlies shooting guard Mike Miller, is set to open its third location in Southaven’s Silo Square at 2903 May Blvd, according to a recent article from the Daily Memphian.

A representative of Let It Fly did not immediately return What Now Memphis’ request for comment.

Priding itself on “[capturing] the energy of what Memphis sports is all about,” Let It Fly boasts private VR golfing bays, plenty of TVs to catch the latest game, and a menu of reliable pub grub such as the Pork Burger, BBQ Platter, Sunrise Chicken sandwich, and Taco Pizza.

Meanwhile, a dedicated brunch menu features classics like Chicken and Waffles, Loaded Hashbrowns, and a Country Benedict, with boozy brunch cocktails to boot.

Miller, an acclaimed basketball player-turned-coach with numerous accolades to his name including NBA Rookie of the Year, NBA Champion, and NBA Sixth Man of the Year, opened the flagship Let It Fly in Germantown in 2019, followed by Sioux Falls two years later.
